title: 112_s1154
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Promises to Service-Disabled Veterans Act of 2011". It includes findings related to service-disabled veterans. Congress acknowledges that federal agencies must comply with the Veterans Entrepreneurship and Small Business Development Act of 1999, which set a goal for awarding contracts to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. Progress in meeting this goal has been slow, and prime contractors working with the government are expected to contribute to achieving it. The public has a right to know if Executive departments and prime contractors are meeting the Government-wide goal for service-disabled veterans. SEC. 3. Transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. Section 15 of the Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. This requires covered contractors to submit reports to the Administrator regarding the percentage of total value of all contracts awarded to such businesses. The Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. Covered contractors must report the percentage of contracts awarded to these businesses, including subcontractor utilization goals negotiated. The Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. Covered contractors must report the percentage of contracts awarded to these businesses and subcontractor utilization goals negotiated. Covered contractors must report the percentage of contracts awarded to these businesses and subcontractor utilization goals negotiated. Additionally, the Administrator will rank Executive departments based on the percentage of prime contracts awarded to small business concerns owned by service-disabled veterans. The Administrator shall publish this information on a website. The Administrator will publish a user-friendly report on a website containing information submitted and rankings made, unless deemed detrimental to national security. The report will be updated regularly. The Administrator must update the website quarterly and submit an annual report to Congress on the progress of Executive departments meeting Government-wide contracting goals. Each report must confirm if the website contains the latest data reported by departments. A recommendation of a prime contractor for outstanding progress in contracting with small business concerns owned by service-disabled veterans is also required. Nothing in this subsection affects any other reporting requirement under Federal law.
